intro: Senecio cuneifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Senecio cuneifolius is often used in ornamental gardening due to its hardy nature and attractive foliage.
